channel.title: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?
channel.description: Like the Ice Burst spell I want to make it so u dont got to wait a certain amount of time to cast on a player, I want to click the spell over and over and keep icing, how do i do this> rep+4

item.title: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

magetimer is what makes it so u can cast faster or slower. I’m not sure how you can only make one spell cast slower. But this will def fix your issue

item.source: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?

item.title: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?
item.dc:creator: @Busta_Blader Busta Blader
item.description:
@Busta_Blader wrote:

Replace the code with this 1 while I have my lunch =].

if(magicID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell) { if(playerLevel[6] >= 94) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==true)) { hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(25); setAnimation(1979); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].PoisonPlayer(); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].uberentangle(); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].inCombat(); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 0; addSkillXP((800*playerLevel[6]), 6); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].sendMessage("You have been frozen!"); //sendMessage("You poison and freeze the enemy!"); stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 2); deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(554), 6); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].currentHealth -= server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].hitDiff; } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } }

Put that there because u need to have a pking delay to 0 for barrage and u need a pking delay for burst.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2008, 09:24:10 PM[/size][hr]And will only be for pking on npc’s you will have to wait the delay.

Read full topic

item.title: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?
item.dc:creator: @Element_SoftwareTM Element SoftwareTM
item.description:
@Element_SoftwareTM wrote:

I want it to work for npc’s, and busta I replaced with what u gave me
but It didnt work, but after i tested i went to client.java and found these 2 more things on it.

if(magicID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell) { if(playerLevel[6] >= 94) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==true)) { hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(25); setAnimation(1979); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].PoisonPlayer(); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].uberentangle(); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].inCombat(); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 15; addSkillXP((800*playerLevel[6]), 6); //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].sendMessage("You have been frozen!"); //sendMessage("You poison and freeze the enemy!"); stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 2); deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(554), 6); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; //server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].currentHealth -= server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].hitDiff; } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } }

and

if(spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell) { if(playerLevel[6] > 93) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 40)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 40)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 60)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); sendMessage("You need 40 "+getItemName(560)+", 40 "+getItemName(4278)+" and 60 "+getItemName(554)); } if(playerBonus[3] <= 1) { castOnPlayer.playerGfx(85,10); sendMessage("get some robes nub."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 40)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(554, 60)==true) && (playerBonus[3] >= 10)) { hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(25); startAnimation(1979); castOnPlayer.PoisonPlayer(); castOnPlayer.uberentangle(); castOnPlayer.inCombat(); inCombat(); stillgfx(85, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); stillgfx(369, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); //stillgfx(387, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); //castOnPlayer.stillgfx(387, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); castOnPlayer.sendMessage("You have been frozen!"); sendMessage("You poison and freeze the enemy!"); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 40); deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 40); deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(554), 60); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } }

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2008, 09:19:03 PM[/size][hr]I want it for pking…

Read full topic

item.title: For Ice Burst, how can I make it like rapid?
item.dc:creator: @Busta_Blader Busta Blader
item.description:
@Busta_Blader wrote:

Just copy and paste

if(spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell) { if(playerLevel[6] > 93) { hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(30); startAnimation(1979); //attackPlayersWithin(369, 59, 30); castOnPlayer.PoisonPlayer(); castOnPlayer.uberentangle(); castOnPlayer.inCombat(); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 0; stillgfx(85, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); //stillgfx(369, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); //castOnPlayer.stillgfx(369, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX); castOnPlayer.sendMessage("You have been frozen!"); sendMessage("You poison and freeze the enemy!"); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { if(playerBonus[3] <= 19) { castOnPlayer.playerGfx(85,10); } sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } }

And if you want it for Barrage just change the pking timer PkingDelay = 0; From the one u have for barrage to this 1.

Read full topic
